did.unittitle: Indiana University University Division Dean's records
did.abstract: The University Division was established at Indiana University Bloomington in 1942, under the name of Junior Division. Originally created as a response to wartime conditions, the University Division currently serves as an academic advising system for freshman and sophomore students who have not yet selected a major. The collection consists primarily of records from Sally J. Dunn's tenure (2000-2007) as Dean of the University Division and includes correspondence, records related to University Division programs, brochures, reports, administrative files, advising files, and publications.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: In 1942 in response to wartime conditions, Indiana University established the Junior Division to ensure that returning veterans would be able to come back to IU with an identifiable amount of academic work completed. The Division also fulfilled requirements for entrance into the Upper Division, where students would study within their majors. The emphasis on academics within the Junior Division was clear as it was also intended to provide standardized entrance requirements as well as guidance and counseling to freshman students during their first year to enable them to achieve maximum success in the transition from high school to college.

In 1970, the Junior Division was officially expanded and renamed University Division, as it no longer served solely the freshmen, but became a two year program for entering students who had not selected a major. The University Division expanded the services of the earlier Division, with the introduction of a decentralized, residency based system of academic advising. In doing so, the University Division expanded upon IUB's commitment to provide students with the support they needed to successful adjust to college life, and as such, extended its services to sophomore students, acknowledging that some students need additional support and time to determine their preferred area of study.

Currently, the University Division serves the majority of undergraduate students entering the University. Students remain in the University Division until they have completed basic requirements and certify into a degree granting major or school. The University Division provides a variety of services including academic advising, exploratory student resources, a Health Professions and Prelaw Center, as well as the Student Academic Center.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into two series: Administrative files and Publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Records in this collection date from the tenure of Sally Dunn, who served as acting dean of the Division from 2000-2001 and dean from 2001-2007.

The University Division Dean's records are organized into two series. The first series, Administrative files (1942-2007), is arranged alphabetically and includes a wide range of materials, including files on general programming activities, academic advising, the migration to Peoplesoft/SIS, freshman entrance and retention, and the history of University Division, as well as annual reports, budgets, and policies and procedures. Additionally, there are files related to committees on which Dean Dunn served and participated.

The second series, Publications (1986-2008) is arranged alphabetically and includes materials used in academic advising such as course planners, course descriptions, and student advising handouts and packets.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Materials relating to student grades were removed and destroyed.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyrights for records originating with Indiana University administrative units, departments, and other offices are held by the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University University Division Dean's records, Collection C346, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Transferred from the University Division to the University Archives, Jan. 2009.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Non-University Division publications were pulled and are located in the Archive's publications collection.
